morning_after.speaker: Narrator
morning_after.text: The morning after the celebration, Dragon Haven Cafe is quiet. The guests have departed, but their warmth lingers in the walls.

mother_packing.speaker: Narrator
mother_packing.text: You find Mother in the guest room, carefully packing a small bag.

player_surprised.speaker: Narrator
player_surprised.text: A pang of concern strikes you. Is she leaving so soon?

mother_explains.speaker: Mother
mother_explains.text: *She turns with a soft smile* Not leaving, my dear. Relocating. There's a small cottage just past the meadow. I thought I might make it home.

mother_gentle.speaker: Mother
mother_gentle.text: *She takes your hands* Oh, my child. I'm not leaving. I was just moving my things to the cottage past the meadow. I plan to stay close.

mother_stays.speaker: Mother
mother_stays.text: The cafe is yours now. Your domain, your responsibility. But I'll be nearby when you need advice... or just when you want company.

relief.speaker: Narrator
relief.text: Relief washes over you. Mother isn't disappearing from your life - she's simply taking her proper place beside it.

mother_wisdom.speaker: Mother
mother_wisdom.text: You know, when I first sent you here, I was terrified. Terrified you'd fail. Terrified you'd succeed. Terrified of what the truth would do to you.

mother_proud.speaker: Mother
mother_proud.text: *Her eyes glisten* But look at you now. The cafe thrives. Your dragon loves you. You've touched so many lives. You've exceeded every hope I ever had.

dragon_joins.speaker: Narrator
dragon_joins.text: Your dragon pads into the room, nuzzling first Mother, then you. Through your bond, you feel its contentment - and something more. Pride.

mother_future.speaker: Mother
mother_future.text: The future is unwritten. There will be challenges ahead - there always are. But you won't face them alone. You have your dragon, your friends, and you have me.

player_grateful.speaker: Narrator
player_grateful.text: You embrace your mother, your dragon curling around you both. This is what family means - not just blood, but choice, love, and unwavering support.

end_scene.speaker: Mother
end_scene.text: Now then, Guardian of Dragon Haven... I believe you have a cafe to run. And I have a cottage to make cozy. We both have new chapters to begin.
